entry.title: JustSim Releases Rhodes International Airport for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. JustSim has released its first scenery fully adapted for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, revisiting a previous destination: Rhodes International Airport (LGRP). Rhodes is a popular summer destination in the Greek Islands, attracting over six million passengers annually. Civil aviation on the island began after World War II with the opening of Rhodes Maritsa Airport, which served as the main airport until Rhodes International Airport, also known as Diagoras International Airport, was inaugurated in 1977. Over the years, the airport has seen improvements, including expanded taxiways and a new passenger terminal that opened in 2005. In 2015, the airport was privatized and is now managed by Fraport AG/Copelouzos Group for a period of 40 years. Today, Rhodes International Airport hosts numerous airlines offering scheduled, seasonal, and charter flights to various destinations across Europe. According to JustFlight, the new scenery features high-resolution ground textures, high-resolution building textures, highly detailed 3D models, custom animated ground vehicles, and much more. The scenery requires 1.66 GB of storage space and is available on SimMarket for approximately $17.28. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: Eagle Dynamics Posts DCS 2025 and Beyond Video
entry.summary: Sim: DCS. Eagle Dynamics has unveiled its DCS 2025 and Beyond video, marking the start of the year for the team. This annual preview highlights new features and add-ons that will enhance the DCS experience. Viewers can expect an in-depth look at upcoming innovations for the flight simulation platform. The video begins by introducing Dynamic Campaigns, a feature that has been highly requested by the community for some time. For the first time since its announcement in last year's video, footage of the upcoming MiG-29A is shown in-game. Additionally, the Eurofighter Typhoon Tranche 1 and 2 are showcased after being absent for two years. Throughout the video, there are glimpses of Berlin, hinting at a potential new map, likely set in Germany. Other teasers include enhanced ground assets, a new variant of the Mirage F1M, the C-130 from Airplane Simulation Company, the Sparrowhawk HUD for both the F-14A and F-14B, and the F-100 Super Sabre. The video suggests that there is a wealth of exciting upcoming content to look forward to. At the video's conclusion, developers announced two exciting new aircraft for DCS. Development will begin in 2025 for a full-fidelity F-15C, an agile air superiority fighter, and an F-35A, a stealthy multirole fighter. Both are expected to be released in 2026. Once more information about any of the teasers is available, we will make sure to let you know. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned to Threshold!

entry.title: FeelThere Releases Washington Dulles International Airport for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. FeelThere has just released its latest scenery for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020: Washington Dulles International Airport (KIAD). Located in Dulles, Virginia, Washington Dulles International Airport is situated 26 miles west of downtown Washington, D.C., the primary city it serves. The airport is the 10th busiest in the United States for international passenger traffic, handling over 20 million passengers annually. It opened on the 17th of November 1962 and is named after John Foster Dulles, a former U.S. Secretary of State. Today, Dulles serves as a hub for United Airlines and is frequently utilised by codeshare partners. According to FeelThere, the airport scenery features highly detailed buildings with PBR texturing, fully modelled terminal interiors, and a realistic ground polygon with authentic decals, dirt, and taxi lines. Additional enhancements include custom animated jetways, an updated AFCAD with accurate parking and signage, and improved lighting for taxiways, runways, and aprons. â The full feature list follows: â Highly detailed buildings with PBR texturing. â Terminal interiors modelled. â Complete modelled ground polygon including realistic decals, dirt, taxi lines and surfaces. â Custom animated jetways. â Airline parking codes and modified airport services. â Updated AFCAD, parking spots, taxiway names and taxi signs. â Improved taxiway and runway lighting. â Custom modelled clutter and unique objects placed throughout the airport. â Improved night lighting and apron lamps. The scenery requires 1.2 GB of storage space and is available for $10.79, which is a 10% discount off the regular price of $11.99, through the FeelThere website. â Stay tuned to Threshold for news, reviews, and more. entry.title: SamScene Releases Kunming Changshui International Airport for MSFS20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. SamScene recently released their rendition of Kunming Changshui International Airport (ZPPP) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The airport serves Kunming, China, with a yearly average of 42 million passengers. Built in 2009 as a replacement for Kunming Wujiaba International Airport, it quickly became one of the busiest airports in the world.Â Its construction time was marked by tragedy, with seven construction workers dying in 2010 after an incomplete overpass collapsed, and eleven workers were injured a year later when a tunnel under construction also collapsed. Such was the cost of finishing such a large project within two years. Its main terminal is China's second-largest terminal building, with 548,300 square meters and 66 gates with jet bridges, 88 in total.Â It's a hub for China Eastern Airlines, Hongtu Airlines, Kunming Airlines, Lucky Air, Ruili Airlines, and Sichuan Airlines. AirAsia, Air China, Batik Air Malaysia, Beijing Capital Airlines, Chengdu Airlines, China Express Airlines, China United Airlines, Hainan Airlines, Hebei Airlines, Juneyao Air, Korean Air, Scoot, Spring Airlines, Thai AirAsia, Tibet Airlines, and Vietnam Airlines also serve it. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with detailed terminal buildings, custom ground markings, custom jetways, 50 iconic buildings, detailed surroundings, and performance-friendly optimization. It's available on SimMarket for roughly $17.16, requiring at least 3.31 GB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Orbx Releases Grumman TBF Avenger for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Orbx has recently released their rendition of the Grumman TBF Avenger for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. This WW2-era airplane was developed for the United States Navy and Marine Corps and eventually adopted by many air and naval aviation services worldwide. It was designed in 1940 to replace the Douglas TBD Devastator, offering an airplane that was very much in line with the technology adopted by the Axis forces at the time, in complete contrast to the Devastator, which was considered obsolete by 1939. The Avenger was designed to easily fit in aircraft carriers, with easily stowable wings that allowed way more airplanes to fit in the same carrier.Â With a maximum speed of 447 km/h, 1456km of total range, and a service ceiling of 22,600 feet, the mighty Avenger was one of the most iconic World War 2 bombers, permanently changing naval warfare.Â Crafted with Paul Bennetâs expertise (an aerobatic pilot who happens to own one of the last airworthy Avengers), the add-on features realistic aerodynamics, high-quality sounds, high-quality 3D modeling and texturing, and much more. Itâs available on OrbxDirect for roughly $17.68, requiring at least 2.23 GB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â
